name: Tickee Widget Plugin
author: Koen Betsens

sections.description: tickee is a free ticketing sales platform built to manage all your events and user data, in a way never done before. It has great features, powerful apps and is easy to set up.
sections.installation:
This section describes how to install the plugin and get it working.

e.g.

  1. Upload tickee-widget.php to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
  3. Edit your settings in Settings > tickee and right on the page or post fields
  4. Place <?php echo tickee() ?> in your templates or [tickee] in your post or widget bar. 4b. Additionaly, you can alter your shortcode with a custom account slug: [tickee slug=’charlatan’]
sections.faq:
Do I need a tickee account to use the plugin?

For your own ticket sales you do, it’s free.

Can I promote other tickee accounts on my blog?

If you have the permission, you can use the tickee plugin with the content of other accounts.
sections.changelog:
0.1

The beta version plugin. Simple but efficient.

0.1.1

The beta version plugin with shortcode support.
